message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the climate and environmental conditions of the tundra. The tundra is a cold biome characterized by freezing temperatures. Without clothing, a person in the tundra would experience extreme cold and would shiver as a natural physiological response to generate heat and try to maintain body temperature. Option (A) is incorrect because a person without clothing in the tundra would not be able to fly. Option (C) is incorrect because heatstroke occurs when the body overheats, which is unlikely to happen in the tundra. Option (D) is unlikely because without clothing, a person would not be able to undress further.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of extreme cold on the human body. When a person is in the tundra without clothing, they will likely experience extreme cold temperatures. Without protection from clothing, the body's natural response to this cold is to shiver. Shivering is a physiological response that generates heat and helps to keep the body warm. Option (A) is incorrect because flying is not a response to extreme cold. Option (C) is incorrect because heatstroke is caused by exposure to extreme heat, not cold. Option (D) is unlikely because without clothing, the person would not have anything to undress from.
